name: Python-Drive-Bot

ENV.description: Setting this to ANYTHING will enable webhooks when in env mode

env.description: The telegram bot token that you get from @BotFather.

description: This is the folder ID of the Google Drive Folder to which you want to upload all the mirrors.

DOWNLOAD_DIR.description: The path to the local folder where the downloads should be downloaded to.

DOWNLOAD_STATUS_UPDATE_INTERVAL.description: A short interval of time in seconds after which the Mirror progress message is updated. (I recommend to keep it 5 seconds at least).

description: The Telegram user ID (not username) of the owner of the bot.

AUTO_DELETE_MESSAGE_DURATION.description: Interval of time (in seconds), after which the bot deletes it's message (and command message) which is expected to be viewed instantly. Note: Set to -1 to never automatically delete messages.

description: Set to 'True' if GDRIVE_FOLDER_ID is from a Team Drive else False or Leave it empty.

USE_SERVICE_ACCOUNTS.description: Whether to use service accounts or not. For this to work see 'Using service accounts' section below.

description: Refer to https://github.com/maple3142/GDIndex/ The URL should not have any trailing '/'.
This is to authenticate to your telegram account for downloading Telegram files. You can get this from https://my.telegram.org DO NOT put this in quotes.
This is to authenticate to your telegram account for downloading Telegram files. You can get this from https://my.telegram.org.
Open this link to generate telegraph token ==> https://telegraph-token.sonywegas.repl.run
Open this link to generate session string ==> https://string-session.sonywegas.repl.run
